1532111121211222111121111212111111112111.title: Mrs. Reed finishes up and leaves.

choices: Robin just wants to go home
15322.content:
Robin watched in embarrassment at John's performance onstage.

“He is too into this,” he thought to himself watching John walk down the steps from the stage.

John quickly made it back to his seat as the audience laughed. He didn't understand what was so funny about randomly being asked questions about him and Robyn. He saw she was looking a little off for some reason. He sat next to her, and turned her cute chin with his hand to face him and he kissed her gently. She moaned a little as she opened her lips for him and not wanting to disappoint, slipped his tongue lovingly into her mouth.

Robin was in shock as John, without hesitation, started to makeout with him in front of all these people. He wanted to stop it but all that came out of him was a groan of disgust. The audience cheered at this scene and Robin had no idea what to do as John tried to explore his mouth. His brain finally caught up with what was happening and he pushed John off him. John smiled at him like this was normal, then put his arm around him pulling him into a snuggle. Robin still hadn't recovered fully after what happened and sat there as John placed a hand on his knee.

“That...uh...kiss was a little much, don't you think?” Robin asked not really looking at John.

“I'm sorry. You are just so cute,” John whispered, slowly rubbing Robin's leg.

It was then that Rex brought the show to it's end. He gave one final speech and released everyone from their hypnosis. John stopped and started to look around. He saw that Robin was real close to him and quickly backed away.

“What happened?” he asked bewildered.
15322.title: John's hypnotism fades, but returns slowly

1533.content:
John and Robin watched the show with amused smiles. They spoke in quiet tones back and forth with how impressed they were with the actors that were pretending to be hypnotized. They pulled off looking like average audience members so well, if Robin and John didn't know hypnosis was fake, they might have thought they weren't actors at all. Now, knowing that it wasn't real didn't take away from the fun.

"Hey, Robin," John turned to his friend.

"Yeah, bro?" Robin asked.

"Thanks for tonight," John said while Robin smiled back at his friend.

They were interrupted from their thoughts when by the hypnotist, Drake Bloodstone's voice and they suddenly realized that he was looking down to them. He pointed to Robin and Robin nervously pointed at himself.

"You there, please come up here. Yes, you, the brunette," Bloodstone confirmed.

Robin got up as John clapped and laughed, excited to see what will happen with his friend. Robin shook Bloodstone's hand.

"Hello, what's your name?" he asked.

"My name is Robin," he said looking at his feet a little.

Robin was normally a fairly outgoing guy, he felt, but being up in front of all these people was terrifying. He crossed his arms over his chest instinctively, unconsciously wanting to protect himself from the gaze of the audience.

"Are you having a good time Robin?" the bald man asks.

"Yes, Sir. I-I've been...uh... having fun," he tells him.

"Well, I'm happy to hear that. Now, take a seat and lets get started," He said, guiding Robin to a chair that was on stage.

Bloodstone put John under slowly and Robin was impressed with how real John made it look. Bloodstone put John through his paces and had him doing some funny behaviors. At one point he had Robin think he was a model walking the catwalk. As Robin Strutted, John wolf-whistled which made the audience laugh. What it also did was bring Bloodstone's attention onto John. Bloodstone had John sit back down and put him back into his trance before speaking.

"So tell me, who is that you were sitting next to?" He asks pointing at John.

"That's John," He said with an even tone.

"Okay. Did you come here together?" He asked Robin.

"Yes. I bought us tickets for tonight because he was feeling down," Robin said.

"That's very kind," Bloodstone told the audience.

"John is my best friend and the best person I know," Robin said honestly, which made John happy to hear.

"That's very nice. So, tell me, how long have you two been dating?" he asked.

"We...we haven't," Robin said confused.

"Oh, so this is your first date. You're a sweet girl, he is a lucky guy that you asked him out," He said to Robin.

Robin didn't say anything, instead he just listened to what Bloodstone said. This was his first date with John and that he was a lucky guy for Robin to ask him out. It didn't make sense to him and his mind stalled as he tried to sort it out. His head hurt trying to rationalize what Bloodstone told him...that he was a sweet girl. John on the other hand was feeling embarrassed for Robin. Bloodstone was confusing Robin for a girl and that must be embarrassing. His hair was long and he was fairly thin so it wasn't completely unthinkable he could make that mistake but his current situation must be humiliating for him. John wondered when he was going to correct him.

"My wife and I were best friends, too. The person you marry should be your best friend. Now, I don't mean to rush things, it's just something you should remember," he tells Robin, who takes in that information.

Bloodstone looked down at Robin's and made an assessment of her. She was a small thing, made all the smaller by her baggy clothes. Clearly she lacked self confidence and probably had issues with body image. John was a good looking guy and she thought really highly of him, so there must be something really special about the guy. Robin was such a good sport, he decided to help set this relationship up for success.

Bloodstone turned fully to the audience while Robin wrestled with the information he was given. He sorted through it as best he could but his mind had to do mental gymnastic to make it happen. Before he came here it had been obvious that he was a guy but how could he be anything but a sweet girl? He decided that he would just focus on the facts to use as an anchor.

Fact: Robin is a sweet girl

Fact: Robin asked John out on a date

Fact: John agreed to the date

Fact: He was having a great time with John

Fact: John is his best friend

Fact: The person he will marry should be his best friend

It all make "sense" but he still wasn't able to wrap his head around it. It was causing him a lot of discomfort try to force it all to feel correct. His mind whirled as Bloodstone addressed the audience.

"I love to entertain but what I love more is helping others where I can so please give me a moment, if you will," he said before turning off his mic and walking back to Robin. While the audience waited, Blood returned to whisper into Robin's ear.

"I'm going to give you some advice. You want to be a good girlfriend for John so the best thing you can do as John's girlfriend is to try to be the best woman just like he should try to be the best man he can be. You are a pretty girl, so don't feel ashamed to show off that you are a pretty girl. When you look at yourself, remember that what you see is a confident woman that any man would be lucky to be with. You are going to be a wonderful wife for the man you choose. Now, go back down to your seat and show John how you feel about him," he instructed before turning his mic back on again.

"Robin, ladies and gentlemen," He said as Robin walked back to her seat to sit with her lucky boyfriend.
1533.title: Robin is mistaken for a shy girl and is hypnotised

15331.content:
Robin quickly made it back to her seat as the audience applauded. She didn't know why, they didn't do anything but talk as far as she knew. Either way she came back down to sit next to her boyfriend. She smiled as she thought about how much she liked him and how handsome he was. He was special to her and she wanted him to know that, so when she sat next to him, she turned his cute chin with her hand to face her and she kissed him gently. He moaned a little as he opened his lips for her and not wanting to disappoint, slipped her tongue lovingly into his mouth. She was glad he said yes to the date, she was going to make sure she was the best girlfriend for him. She didn't know why it had taken her this long to see how perfect he was for her but she was never going to let him go now.

John was in shock as Robin, without hesitation, started to makeout with him in front of all these people. He wanted to stop it but all that came out of him was a groan of disgust. The John had no idea what to do as Robin tried to explore his mouth and found himself frozen in shock. His brain finally caught up with what was happening and he pushed Robin off him. Robin smiled at him like this was normal, then put John's arm around him and leaned into him to a snuggle. John still hadn't recovered fully after what happened and sat there as Robin took John's hand in his.

“What are you doing?” John asked horrified.

“I'm just so glad to be with you tonight,” Robin whispered into his ear.

It was then that Bloodstone started to bring the show to it's end. John's mind was going a mile a minute trying to figure out what was going on when Bloodstone collapsed on stage. There were murmurs from the audience as stage crew came running. An ambulance was called and the audience was ushered out.

John found himself walking outside with Robin still holding his hand.
15331.title: Robin kisses John

choices: John drops Robin off at home
153311.content:
"So, where do you want to go now?" Robin asked unsure what to do after seeing that poor man on stage.

John finally was able to get his hand back from Robin with a yank. John looked at his friend with confusion as he tried to figure out what was going on with him.

"Are you okay?" Robin asked John.

"What happened back there?" John said, finally finding the words.

"I don't know, he seemed okay enough. Maybe the heat from the lights got to him? He was sweating," Robin answered.

"No...No, not that. Dude, you kissed me in front of all those people..." John said.

"Oh, I'm sorry...I just...I've never been someone's girlfriend before...I thought it you'd like it," Robin tried to explain.

John's jaw dropped at that. Did he say girlfriend? Robin looked hurt and embarrassed but did Robin believed what he was saying?

"I am sorry. I didn't realize that kissing you in front of all of those people was going to bother you. I promise I won't do it again. I wouldn't hurt you on purpose," she told John.

"Dude, you're not a girl..." John told him, getting freaked out.

"I'm...what?," Robin said slowly.

Robin closed his eyes, pain on his face, and he grabbed his head. He started to sway and began to fall over but John moved fast. He grabbed Robin, luckily, before he hit the ground. He held his friend in his arms, afraid of what was happening to him. The moment eventually passed but it felt like ages until Robin seemed okay.

"What happened?" Robin asked in a soft, pained voice.

"I don't know," John said not sure, himself.

"I think I want to go home..." Robin told her boyfriend.

"Sure. Okay," John said leading him to the car.

The two of them drove home in silence. Robin looked out the window not really able to focus. John glanced over to his friend and worried. Hypnosis couldn't be real, could it? It would explain Robin's behavior but this was insane. John pulled up to the house and looked at Robin, who he was clearly not okay. That reaction of being told the truth was awful to experience and he never wanted to put Robin through it again.
153311.title: They call it a night

1533111.content:
Once inside, John sighed and tried to think of something to say. He didn't want to do this but Robin was really looking off.

“...are you okay?” He asked, wanting to hear him respond to him.

“I'm okay, Robin,” he said weakly.

“I hope so. Maybe you should to head to bed, maybe you'll feel better in the morning,” he suggested.

Robin looked up at him with big eyes. John took a breath and walked over to him and hugged him. John was really worried but the hug seemed to wake Robin up from his stupor. Robin cuddled in and made a soft noise of happiness.

"Yeah, I'm pretty beat, I guess its time to get some beauty sleep," she told her boyfriend.

"Goodnight, Robin," he told him.

“Goodnight, John,” Robin said touching the side of John's face, looking up at him.

John screamed in his head as Robin stood up on his tippy toes and pressed his lips to John's. They kissed gently and John tried with all his might not to run away. Instead he stood there and tried to return the kiss until he couldn't stand it any longer. He pulled away to see Robin's bright smile.

"At leased he seems..."okay" now," John thought.

Robin turned away and glided into his room, swaying his hips gently. John went to his own room but sleep was hard to get as he couldn't stop thinking of their kisses.

“I hope he is better in the morning.”
1533111.title: John plays along

15331111.content:
John woke up slowly as the events of the night before started to come back to him. He closed his eyes and tried to will it all into a dream but there was no undoing it, though he certainly put in the effort. He sat up and started his morning routine, not ready to face the day. While getting dressed for work he heard rustling in the house, clearly Robin was already up.

"Maybe his brain just needed a night's sleep to reboot itself," he thought.

After hesitating for a long moment, John took a breath and exited his bedroom. He walked to the kitchen and saw Robin leaning over a bowl of cereal, his face in his phone. It looked like he wore the same thing he was wearing the night before, probably just falling asleep in it.

"Hey," Robin grunted without looking at John.

"Hey, Robin...how are you?" John asked cautiously.

"Whoever invented mornings should be shot," Robin told him.

John sighed in relief internally at that, glad to see that like Robin was still Robin. He quickly made them some coffee and toasted him some bread. He placed a cup in front of Robin which Robin took into his hands.

"God, you're amazing," Robin said taking a sip.

"I need to fly, I see you after work," John said on his way out.

Robin watched as John hurried out the door. She was a little disappointed that he didn't stop for a kiss but he was in a hurry. She took consolation in watching his ass as he walked away.

"He does look sexy in those slacks. Now I wish we got up a little early so we could have had a little fun," she murmured into her coffee.

Robin finished her cereal and the coffee her boyfriend made for her and decided to start her day.
15331111.title: Robin seems fine at first

153311112.content:
Robin quickly rinsed out the bowl and cup she was using and dragged herself to the bathroom. She was definitely not a morning person. It was made all the worse that she had been sleeping in since she lost her retail job not long ago. Luckily she had saved up a good amount that she could live off of for a while but she needed to get herself back in gear. It was either that or let John handle everything when they get married.

“I'm not going to be a housewife, that would drive me nuts,” she said to no one.

She knew that she had to keep herself in check about the whole marriage thing, after all, her and John only just started dating. That said, she knew that she wanted John in her life forever, she always had. He was her best friend and she always wanted to marry her best friend. Robin was lost in thought when she caught her reflection in the mirror. She looked at herself for a long moment, almost like she didn't know what she was looking at. Her hair was a mess and she looked over tired.

“Damn girl, no wonder he didn't kiss you this morning, you look like death,” she said to her reflection.

She disrobed and looked at herself in the mirror. She was a thin girl and fairly flat up top and it suddenly became clear that she had not been taking care of herself very well. She couldn't remember the last time she shaved, her legs looked like she would need a lawnmower to trim it back. She had always been hairier than your average woman, much to her own frustration, so it was clear how it could get away from her like that. She gathered her shaving cream and razor grumbling about this situation.

“God, I hate maintenance. Maybe I should look into a more long term solution?” She said stepping into the shower.

She lathered up her body and began to carefully remove the unwanted hair from everywhere she could reach. It took longer than she would have liked which only reinforced her previous plan of doing something permanent about it. She rinsed off and and then went about cleaning her body. She rubbed herself and closed her eyes thinking about the night before. She smiled at the memory of John's lips on hers as her hands began to play with her nipples. She thought about what could have happened the night before if she hadn't been so tired. How she could have lifted John's shirt and touched his chest...how her hands could have...explored...

One of Robin's hands slid down her body onto her crotch and she pause. Something wasn't right but she didn't know what it could be. Still, she was turned on and wanted to finish, so she rubbed herself thinking about her boyfriend's body. She rubbed and imagined until she pushed herself over the edge and climaxed hard in the shower. She didn't remember ever cumming that hard before and could only guys how having the real thing was going to feel.
153311112.title: Robin gets cleaned up

1533111121.content:
Robin gets cleaned up, and checks her wardrobe. Very masculine clothes.

"Man, this is why I look so ugly, I need a change of clothes. To the mall!" She says to herself.

She puts on a pair of sweatpants, a hoodie and ties her hair back.

She goes to a store in the mall, grabs all the clothes she can carry and speaks to the clerk.

"Excuse me, miss?" The clerk asks.

Already a step up. As recent as yesterday, strangers on the street were calling her "sir."

"I'd like to try these on, is there a place for that?"

The clerk points to a changing room, and she gets out all the clothes. Various dresses and skirts get put on, but for now, she's in Yoga Pants, a pink t-shirt, and sneakers. She pays for the clothes, and goes on her way.
1533111121.title: Go clothes shopping

choices: Robin sleeps in the same bed as John.
15331111211.content:
After this clothing success, Robin goes home and relaxes.

As it turns out a few hours later, Robin didn't tie her hair back enough, so it falls off, making her hair more male-looking.

As Robin goes to look for her hair tie, John comes up. He looks at Robin, but doesn't see anything wrong.

"Hi John! How was your day?" She asks with a smile.

"Fine. Yours?"

"Great. I got new clothes, my old ones were lacking. My wardrobe improved!"

John nods. He walks away before Robin can go in for a kiss.
15331111211.title: Meeting up with John

153311112111.content:
Robin walks into John's room, and sees John, sound asleep. Knowing her boyfriend had a hard day, she lays next to him, and wraps her arms around him.

"Oh, John." She thinks to herself. What a man.

She kisses him in his sleep, but he doesn't even feel it.
153311112111.title: Robin sleeps in the same bed as John.
